cellularAutomata.rules
Class Network

java.lang.Object
  cellularAutomata.rules.RuleActions
      cellularAutomata.rules.Rule
          cellularAutomata.rules.NRule
              cellularAutomata.rules.templates.NRuleTemplate
                  cellularAutomata.rules.templates.FiniteObjectRuleTemplate
                      cellularAutomata.rules.Network
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener
public class Network
extends FiniteObjectRuleTemplate

A rule for particles travelling along a network. Has three states: blank, wire, and particle. Particles travel on wires but not on blank sites. Every state has an associated direction, and particles only move in that direction.

The rules are: (1) A wire state changes to a particle state if any of it's upstream neighbors are a particle. Upstream neighbors are neighbors that point in the direction of the wire state. (2) A particle state changes to a wire state if there is no neighbor that is an upstream particle. (3) Otherwise the cell remains unchanged. The direction of each cell is fixed at its initial direction for all time, independent of the state (wire, blank, or particle). So if a particle moves into a cell, then the particle adopts the direction of that cell.

Author:
David Bahr

Method Detail

getCompatibleLattices

public java.lang.String[] getCompatibleLattices()
A list of lattices with which this Rule will work, which in this case, is only the square lattice.
Well-designed Rules should work with any lattice, but some may require particular topological or geometrical information (like the lattice gas). Appropriate strings to return in the array include SquareLattice.DISPLAY_NAME, HexagonalLattice.DISPLAY_NAME, StandardOneDimensionalLattice.DISPLAY_NAME, etc.

Overrides:
getCompatibleLattices in class FiniteObjectRuleTemplate
Returns:
A list of lattices compatible with this Rule.

getToolTipDescription

public java.lang.String getToolTipDescription()
A brief description (written in HTML) that describes this rule. The description will be displayed as a tooltip. Using html permits line breaks, font colors, etcetera, as described in HTML resources. Regular line breaks will not work.

Specified by:
getToolTipDescription in class Rule
Returns:
An HTML string describing this rule.
